doc:
Timothy Bateson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_Bateson 0 Timothy Dingwall Bateson (3 April 1926 – 16 September 2009) was an English actor. Born in London, the son of Dingwall Latham Bateson, a solicitor later knighted, he was educated at Uppingham School in Rutland and Wadham College, Oxford. At Oxford, he read history and performed in the Oxford University Dramatic Society.Bateson's stage credits included the first British production of Samuel Beckett's Waiting for Godot in 1955 at the Arts Theatre in London in a production directed by Peter Hall.He appeared in many film, television and radio productions including The Cadfael Chronicles, Doctor Who (in the serial entitled The Ribos Operation) and Labyrinth. He also provided the voices for several characters in the children's TV series TUGS (1988). Since 1994, he did the voice of Measley from the audiotape version of the Animals of Farthing Wood. He voiced the house-elf Kreacher in Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, his last work. Timothy_Dingwall_Bateson ( 3_April_1926 – 16_September_2009 ) was an_English_actor . Born in London , the_son of Dingwall_Latham_Bateson , a_solicitor later knighted , he was_educated at Uppingham_School in Rutland and Wadham_College , Oxford . At Oxford , he read history and performed in the_Oxford_University_Dramatic_Society.Bateson 's_stage_credits included the_first_British_production of Samuel_Beckett 's_Waiting for Godot in 1955 at the_Arts_Theatre in London in a_production directed by Peter_Hall.He appeared in many_film_,_television_and_radio_productions including The_Cadfael_Chronicles , Doctor Who ( in the_serial entitled The_Ribos_Operation_)_and_Labyrinth . He also provided the_voices for several_characters in the_children 's_TV_series_TUGS ( 1988_) . Since 1994 , he did the_voice of Measley from the_audiotape_version of the_Animals of Farthing_Wood . He voiced the_house-elf_Kreacher in Harry_Potter and the_Order of the_Phoenix , his_last_work .
